abstracts.cdata!:
The Sao Domingo - Vila de Assomada road,
            is the main sector of the ring road serving the
            country's main island of Santiago. However,
            rehabilitation of this road may potentially disturb the
            environment as a result of construction works, inadequate
            site selection, and adversity to natural vegetation.
            Mitigation measures include: 1) engineering design shall
            take into consideration terrain conditions for installation
            of sewers, and drainage systems, to prevent soil erosion,
            and groundwater contamination. Moreover, the construction
            yard (for the installation of construction equipment,
            materials, and workers' lodgings), shall be enclosed by
            protective barriers, and will undergo inspection by local
            authorities prior to construction; 3) minimal disruption to
            natural flora is expected to occur; however, vegetation
            shall be restored, following construction, with the approval
            of local authorities; 4) excavation works required for road
            widening, shall be conducted during the dry season to
            minimize soil erosion. In addition, contractors shall submit
            a plan for the use of explosives, subject to approval by
            local authorities, which should include emergency procedures
            in case of accidents, and pollution contamination; and, 5)
            during the rainy season, the contractor shall be responsible
            for vegetative propagation on slopes, to prevent soil
            erosion; and, construction sites shall be regularly sprayed
            to prevent dusting.
